SEARCH
Package model

Class Board

java.lang.Object
model.Board
public class Board extends Object
Represents the game board in the Connect 4 game.

It provides operations for managing and updating the game board, validating player drops, and checking for a game win/draw.

See Also:
  • BoardCell

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board()
      Initializes an empty 6x7 game board.

  • Method Details

    • isFull

      public boolean isFull()
      Returns whether all the cells in the game board have already been used.
      Returns:
      true if all the cells in the game board have already been used; Otherwise, false.

    • isValidDrop

      public boolean isValidDrop(int columnId)
      Returns whether dropping a checker in the specified column is a valid move.
      Parameters:
      columnId - the index (0-indexed) of the column where the checker is to be dropped.
      Returns:
      true if it's a valid move to drop a checker in the specified column; Otherwise, false.

    • isValidChecker

      public boolean isValidChecker(BoardCell checker)
      Returns whether the specified checker is a valid checker type.
      Parameters:
      checker - a BoardCell instance representing a checker (Must be either 'X' or 'O').
      Returns:
      true if the specified checker is valid; Otherwise, false.

    • dropChecker

      public boolean dropChecker(int columnId, BoardCell checker)
      Drops a checker in the specified column. If the column is already full, the drop operation fails and this method would return false.
      Parameters:
      columnId - the index (0-indexed) of the column where the checker is to be dropped.
      checker - a BoardCell instance representing a checker (Must be either 'X' or 'O').
      Returns:
      true if the drop operation is successful; Otherwise, false.

    • checkIfWinning

      public boolean checkIfWinning(BoardCell checker)
      Returns whether the player with the specified checker has reached a winning condition.

      It will check if any of the following winning conditions has been reached:

      1. Four consecutive same-type checkers in horizontal.
      2. Four consecutive same-type checkers in vertical.
      3. Four consecutive same-type checkers in a positively sloped diagonal.
      4. Four consecutive same-type checkers in a negatively sloped diagonal.
      Parameters:
      checker - a BoardCell instance representing a checker (Must be either 'X' or 'O').
      Returns:
      true if the player has reached a winning condition; Otherwise, false.

    • display

      public void display()
      Displays the current state of the game board to the console through a text-based user interface.
